column4: guys help in breezy when I go to networking config properties and edit properties for wireless connection it locks up and i have to force quit it then after that gnome gets really glitched need some assistance
How many instances of network-admin are running (both defunct and alive)?

: not sure but... The first time I try it it locks up, then I have to force quit it....then if I try opening network admin again, I see "opening network admin" thing in the toolbar and then after a few seconds it just disapears
Then after that, if i try opening OpenOffice 2 it does the same thing...
Do a, "ps -A | grep network-admin" to see if any are still hanging around.
im in windows right now...i cant set up my internet connection on linux because the network config keeps freezing
ill chek in just a sec
Is the Linux box on a separate machine?
No its on the same system but on a different hard drive
brb gonna go test that command

Once you do a fresh boot up, that command will not return anything since you won't have launched it.  It's merely a way to see if any defunct network-admin processes are still hanging around after the fact.
so what if some defunct network admin processes are there what do I do
Helping you troubleshoot this issue will be very time consuming if you have to keep booting back and forth.  Any other PCs with Internet access?
yes but there in use h/o ill see if I can get a hold of teh lap top
Well, you'd want to kill them and then try and figure out why it's having trouble running in the first place.
